SCS560.name: Introduction to Shelter Veterinary Medicine
SCS560.description: Introduction to shelter veterinary medicine. Field trips required.
SCS560.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine or in the Department of Small Animal Clinical Sciences.

SCS561.name: Clinical Competencies III
SCS561.description: Development of skills for the safe and humane examination and handling of dogs and cats. Performance of common procedures for obtaining specimens and administering medication.
SCS561.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

SCS563.name: Introduction to Exotic Species and Small Mammal Medicine
SCS563.description: Basic anatomy, physiology, and common disease processes of small mammals, birds, and reptiles. Species include ferrets, rabbits, guinea pigs, small rodents, pet birds, and reptiles.
SCS563.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

SCS564.name: Applied Small Animal Nutrition
SCS564.description: Principles of life stage nutrition and making dietary recommendations for healthy and sick small animal patients.
SCS564.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

SCS565.name: Animal Behavior
SCS565.description: Diagnosis, treatment and prevention of behavioral problems in dogs and cats. Topics include problem prevention, behavioral intervention, aggression, anxiety related problems, inappropriate elimination, normal unwanted behavior, client counseling and interaction, and companion animal welfare.
SCS565.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

SCS566.name: Emergency and Critical Care Medicine Seminars
SCS566.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
SCS566.description: Case-based discussion of small animal veterinary emergency and critical care medical issues.
SCS566.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

SCS567.name: Small Animal Clinical Oncology
SCS567.description: Overview of cancer in dogs and cats. Clinical management.
SCS567.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

SCS568.name: Small Animal Advanced Orthopedics Seminars
SCS568.description: Basic biomechanics and research in orthopedics including novel concepts and techniques in fracture management, arthropathies, corrective osteotomies, implant design, and performance.
SCS568.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

SCS569.name: Cardiology
SCS569.description: Develop skills and gain experience in common diagnostic tests. Cardiac structure and function. Medical and surgical therapy of common cardiac diseases. Case presentations. Laboratories and small group discussion.
SCS569.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine or in the Department of Small Animal Clinical Sciences.

SCS590.name: Selective Topics in Small Animal Clinical Sciences
SCS590.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
SCS590.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

SCS611.name: Diagnostic Imaging Clerkship
SCS611.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCS611.description: Diagnostic radiography and ultrasound imaging. Radiation safety. Special procedures.

SCS612.name: Problems in Diagnostic Imaging Clerkship
SCS612.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCS612.description: Advanced diagnostic radiography, ultrasound imaging, and magnetic resonance imaging.

SCS613.name: Diagnostic Ultrasound Clerkship
SCS613.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCS613.description: Principles of ultrasound physics, ultrasound scanning techniques, and interpretation of ultrasound imaging.
SCS613.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

SCS625.name: Small Animal Primary Care Clerkship
SCS625.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCS625.description: Primary care for wellness, common injuries, and illnesses.
SCS625.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

SCS626.name: Small Animal Soft Tissue Surgery Clerkship
SCS626.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCS626.description: Diagnosis and preoperative, surgical, and postoperative care of patients requiring routine elective and major soft- tissue surgical procedures.
SCS626.restrictions: Open only to graduate-professional students in College of Veterinary Medicine.

SCS630.name: Spay/Neuter Clerkship
SCS630.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCS630.description: Ovariohysterectomy or orchiectomy. Aspects of pre- and post-operative management and anesthesia.

SCS636.name: Problems in Soft Tissue Surgery Clerkship
SCS636.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year

SCS637.name: Operative Surgery: Instruction and Review
SCS637.description: Participation in the instruction of VM 557 (Operative Surgery), with preparation for the laboratory and discussion after the laboratory. Performance of additional surgical procedures, case discussions, rounds, and anatomy review. Approved independent study project required.
SCS637.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

SCS640.name: Cardiology Clerkship
SCS640.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCS640.description: Diagnosis and medical, and surgical treatment of small animal thoracic and cardiovascular disorders.
SCS640.restrictions: Open only to graduate-professional students in College of Veterinary Medicine.

SCS641.name: Comparative Ophthalmology Clerkship
SCS641.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCS641.description: Ophthalmic evaluation of all species. Diagnosis and medical and surgical treatment of ophthalmic disease.
SCS641.restrictions: Open only to graduate-professional students in College of Veterinary Medicine.

SCS642.name: Zoo and Wildlife Clerkship
SCS642.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCS642.description: Zoo animal and wildlife medicine and surgery.
SCS642.restrictions: Open to veterinary medicine students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

SCS643.name: Neurology Clerkship
SCS643.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCS643.description: Diagnosis, medical and surgical treatment of small animal neurological disorders.
SCS643.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

SCS644.name: Dermatology Clerkship
SCS644.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCS644.description: Diagnosis and treatment of small animal dermatological disorders.
SCS644.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

SCS645.name: Intensive Care Unit Clerkship
SCS645.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCS645.description: Intensive care and management of critically ill small animals.
SCS645.restrictions: Open only to graduate-professional students in College of Veterinary Medicine.

SCS646.name: Small Animal Orthopedic Surgery Clerkship
SCS646.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCS646.description: Diagnosis and preoperative, surgical, and postoperative care of patients requiring routine and major orthopedic surgical procedures.
SCS646.restrictions: Open only to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

SCS647.name: Small Animal Internal Medicine Clerkship
SCS647.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCS647.description: Diagnosis and therapy for complicated medical cases of small animals.
SCS647.restrictions: Open only to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

SCS648.name: Anesthesia Clerkship
SCS648.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCS648.description: Pre-anesthesia evaluation, induction, monitoring, and recovery of small animal patients requiring routine and major surgical procedure.

SCS651.name: Advanced Comparative Ophthalmology Clerkship
SCS651.description: Problem-oriented approach to complex ocular disease processes at the gross and microscopic levels.

SCS653.name: Problems in Neurology Clerkship
SCS653.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year

SCS654.name: Clinical Medical Oncology Clerkship
SCS654.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCS654.description: Management of veterinary cancer patients, including diagnosis, staging evaluation, prognostication and multimodality therapy. Daily clinical rounds and didactic topics.
SCS654.restrictions: Open to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

SCS670.name: Clinical Nutrition for Small Animals
SCS670.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
SCS670.description: Principles of clinical nutrition and dietetics for dogs and cats

SCS690.name: Veterinary Molecular Biology Clerkship
SCS690.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCS690.description: Concepts and techniques of veterinary molecular biology.

SCS693.name: Problems in Small Animal Clinical Sciences Clerkship
SCS693.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year

SCS694.name: Small Animal Specialty Practice Clerkship
SCS694.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCS694.description: Supervised, off-campus, specialty practice experience in an assigned veterinary practice or other school of veterinary medicine.
SCS694.restrictions: Open to veterinary medicine students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

SCS695.name: Emergency and Critical Care Medicine Clerkship
SCS695.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCS695.description: Admission, triage, diagnosis, treatment, and discharge of patients entering an emergency service. Daily instructional rounds.
SCS695.restrictions: Open only to graduate-professional students in the College of Veterinary Medicine.

SCS808.name: Problems in Small Animal Surgery
SCS808.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCS808.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the Department of Small Animal Clinical Sciences.

SCS813.name: Small Animal Seminar
SCS813.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCS813.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the Department of Small Animal Clinical Sciences.

SCS830.name: Comparative Systems Review in Oncologic Medicine - Supradiaphragmatic
SCS830.description: Literature review of supradiaphragmatic oncologic diseases organized by organ system. Comparative aspects of the specific malignancies in human and veterinary oncology.

SCS831.name: Comparative Systems Review in Oncologic Medicine - Subdiaphragmatic
SCS831.description: Literature review of subdiaphragmatic oncologic diseases organized by organ system. Comparative aspects of the specific malignancies in human and veterinary oncology.

SCS899.name: Master's Thesis Research
SCS899.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
SCS899.restrictions: Open only to graduate students in the Department of Small Animal Clinical Sciences.
